FuncDef: The statistics enable command enables IPv4 and IPv6 traffic statistics collection on a Layer 3 main interface. The undo statistics enable command disables IPv4 and IPv6 traffic statistics collection on a Layer 3 main interface. By default, traffic statistics collection is disabled on a Layer 3 main interface.
CLIs: statistics { ipv4 | ipv6 } enable [ inbound | outbound ]
undo statistics { ipv4 | ipv6 } enable [ inbound | outbound ]
ParentView: 100GE interface view,10GE interface view,200GE interface view,25GE interface view,400GE interface view,50GE interface view,Eth-Trunk interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Enables traffic statistics collection of IPv4 packets.
-

Enables traffic statistics collection of IPv6 packets.
-

Enables traffic statistics collection in the inbound direction of an interface.
-

Enables traffic statistics collection in the outbound direction of an interface.
-

ExtraInfo: To check the network status or locate network faults, you can enable traffic statistics collection on Layer 3 main interfaces, so that statistics on incoming and outgoing traffic on Layer 3 main interfaces are collected.
